content.raw:
Ah. Then the problem is that blacs is running with the working directory set to the blacs directory. Try running it with "python -m blacs" from un unrelated directory. Though it changes directory at some point so whether that helps will depend on whether the directory changes before the import or not.

And since running in the directory is how the launchers currently work, we will have to change the launchers or change the module name. Probably changing the module name is the way to go.

Ah. Then the problem is that blacs is running with the working directory set to the blacs directory. Try running it with "python -m blacs" from un unrelated directory. Though it changes directory at some point so whether that helps will depend on whether the directory changes before the import or not.

And since running in the directory is how the launchers currently work, we will have to change the launchers or change the module name. Probably changing the module name is the way to go.
